title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restrictive
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restrictive 

Measures concerning Iran) (No. 3) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (restrictive measure concerning iran) (no 3) regulation 2020

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations - 

“Council Regulation” means Council Regulation (EU) No 267/2012 of 23 March 
20121 as amended by the European acts specified in Schedule 1; 

“European act” means an act adopted by an institution of the European Union or 
an institution of the European Communities. 

(2) A word or expression which is used in these Regulations and which is 
also used in the Council Regulation has, unless the context otherwise requires, 
the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - council regulation mean council regulation (eu) 267 2012 23 march 20121 amended european act specified schedule 1 european act mean act adopted institution european union institution european community (2) word expression used regulation also used council regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation council regulation

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 3. A person who contravenes a provision of the Council Regulation
text_raw:
3. A person who contravenes a provision of the Council Regulation 

specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.
text_norm: 3 person contravenes provision council regulation specified part 1 schedule 2 shall guilty offence

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 4. Notwithstanding Regulation 3, a person who has received an
text_raw:
4. Notwithstanding Regulation 3, a person who has received an 
authorisation under a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 2 of 
Schedule 2 may, subject to compliance with the terms and conditions of such 
authorisation, do such of the things as are so authorised.
text_norm: 4 notwithstanding regulation 3 person received authorisation provision council regulation specified part 2 schedule 2 may subject compliance term condition authorisation thing authorised

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 5. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable -
text_raw:
5. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable - 

(a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for 

a term not exceeding 12 months or to both, or 

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or 
to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or to both.
text_norm: 5 person guilty offence regulation 3 shall liable - (a) summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 12 month (b) conviction indictment fine exceeding eur500 000 imprisonment term exceeding 3 year both

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 6. A competent authority in the State, following such consultation as it
text_raw:
6. A competent authority in the State, following such consultation as it 
considers necessary with other competent authorities, for the purposes of the 

1 OJ L 88, 24.3.2012, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 22nd December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [622] 3 

administration and enforcement of the Council Regulation or these Regulations, 
may give in writing such directions to a person as it sees fit.
text_norm: 6 competent authority state following consultation considers necessary competent authority purpose 1 oj l 88 24.3.2012 p.1 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 22nd december 2020 622 3 administration enforcement council regulation regulation may give writing direction person see fit

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 7. A person who fails to comply with a direction given under Regulation 6
text_raw:
7. A person who fails to comply with a direction given under Regulation 6 
within the time specified in the direction shall be guilty of an offence and shall 
be liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term 
not exceeding 6 months or to both.
text_norm: 7 person fails comply direction given regulation 6 within time specified direction shall guilty offence shall liable summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 6 month both

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 8. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body
text_raw:
8. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body 
corporate and is proved to have been so committed with the consent or 
connivance of or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of any person, being 
a director, manager, secretary or other officer of the body corporate, or a person 
who was purporting to act in such capacity, that person shall, as well as the body 
corporate, be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and 
punished as if he or she were guilty of the first-mentioned offence.
text_norm: 8 offence regulation committed body corporate proved committed consent connivance attributable neglect part person director manager secretary officer body corporate person purporting act capacity person shall well body corporate guilty offence shall liable proceeded punished guilty first-mentioned offence

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 9. (1) Proceedings for an offence under these Regulations in relation to an
text_raw:
9. (1) Proceedings for an offence under these Regulations in relation to an 
act committed outside the State may be taken in any place in the State and the 
offence may for all incidental purposes be treated as having been committed in 
that place. 

(2) Where a person is charged with an offence referred to in paragraph (1), 
no further proceedings in the matter (other than any remand in custody or on 
bail) may be taken except by or with the consent of the Director of Public 
Prosecutions. 

(3) In proceedings for an offence referred to in paragraph (1) - 

(a) 

(b) 

a certificate purporting to be signed by an officer of the 
Department of Foreign Affairs and stating that a passport was 
issued by that Department to a person on a specified date, and 

a certificate that is signed by an officer of the Minister for Justice 
and stating that, to the best of the officer’s knowledge and belief, 
the person has not ceased to be an Irish citizen, 

is evidence that the person was an Irish citizen on the date on which the offence 
is alleged to have been committed, and is taken to have been signed by the person 
purporting to have signed it, unless the contrary is shown. 

(4) A person who has been acquitted or convicted of an offence in a place 
outside the State shall not be proceeded against for an offence under these 
Regulations in relation to an act committed outside the State consisting of the 
conduct, or substantially the same conduct, that constituted the offence of which 
the person has been acquitted or convicted.
text_norm: 9 (1) proceeding offence regulation relation act committed outside state may taken place state offence may incidental purpose treated committed place (2) person charged offence referred paragraph (1) proceeding matter (other remand custody bail) may taken except consent director public prosecution (3) proceeding offence referred paragraph (1) - (a) (b) certificate purporting signed officer department foreign affair stating passport issued department person specified date certificate signed officer minister justice stating best officer knowledge belief person ceased irish citizen evidence person irish citizen date offence alleged committed taken signed person purporting signed unless contrary shown (4) person acquitted convicted offence place outside state shall proceeded offence regulation relation act committed outside state consisting conduct substantially conduct constituted offence person acquitted convicted

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving full effect
heading: 10. The European Union (Restrictive Measures concerning Iran) (No. 2)
text_raw:
10. The European Union (Restrictive Measures concerning Iran) (No. 2) 

Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 389 of 2020) are revoked. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [622]

Council Regulation
